item.description:
Rawluck & Speakers brought to you by WRNEC
RSVP now for Tuesday, Jan. 15, 5:30 - 9:00

Special RSVP instructions:
To RSVP, please use both the Meetup system AND call Betsy Bragg, Health Educator & Coach, at 781-899-6664, (cell) 617-835-2913 or email Betsy@rawnewenglandcommunity.com . If you only use the Meetup RSVP system, then you won't be registered. Thank you for understanding.

Special note: the last event hosted by WRNEC was overbooked and some folks had to be turned away. I am sorry that this happened. The venue has been changed to a location that holds 50% more people, which should eliminate this problem going forward for some time to come.

Featured Speakers: Dr. David Carmos and Dr. Shawn Miller are the authors of the best-selling book on natural living foods, YOU'RE NEVER TOO OLD TO BECOME YOUNG. These popular speakers from La Jolla, California, will give their inspiring new presentation "Forever Young, Forever Healthy" They will bring a video to be shown at 5:30, The video is an interview of Dr. Ann Wigmore conducted by her long time friend, Dr. David Carmos in May 1991, in San Diego.

Drs. Shawn and David have developed their own theory on how to reverse the aging process. Their presentation is packed with revolutionary information: the latest scientific research on the whole raw food diet; the main causes of the killer diseases, and how to reverse them by natural means; staying on a raw diet; staying on a raw diet in the midst of our daily and common temptations; how to go on a transitional and cleansing diet healthfully; common errors that occur on a raw food regimen; the most important foods to eat to attain and maintain health; And much more! Come and Be Motivated!

All those attending are requested to bring a raw, organic, unprocessed, non-animal, non-honey based ready- to-serve dish for 6 - 8 people. Please bring serving utensils labeled with your name on them. Bring a typed or neatly written recipe to display next to your dish.
For recipe ideas, go to http://www.rawnewengl... .

The cost is $10 per person, $5 for members of WRNEC.

New Location - The University of Massachusetts Waltham Center, 240 Beaver St, Waltham, MA 02452 (across from the Girl Scouts and a block from Bentley College). Call 781-891-0650 x 56 for directions. Plenty of parking and handicapped access; seats 150; entrance lobby has tables for your resources to share. You are welcome to bring guests.

Volunteers needed. Call Betsy (see above for number).
item.name: Waltham (WRNEC) Rawluck & Speakers
